fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36075].
  {panel}

A customizable "*Empty trash*" mechanism which would automatically purge from each space trash all deleted files whose deletion is dated before a customizable time range value. The frequence of the purge could also be customizable.

The function would be customized through the following interfaces:
* a site admin interface where site-wide defaults are defined (with "Never purge" as a possible choice)
* a space admin interface where site-wide defaults can be overridden by local values

Advantages of regularly purging deleted pages through such a mechanism would include:
* releasing unneeded data and database space
* preventing side effects and problems, such as the one documented in [Page cannot be moved between spaces due to existing duplicate in trash|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/r4QtKQ]
* eliminating the time-consuming (and needless) chore for admins to manually sort and purge deleted files
* by-passing a limitation of the present "Trash" listing, where there is no "Deleted on" column on which a selective purge could be based
fields.summary: Empty space trash automatically.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36062].
  {panel}

*Background of The Request*

At the moment, user don't have any description or warning before they can export their  space or page from  Confluence OnDemand Instance. User only can see the warning when they want to create backup in Confluence OnDemand.

*Example*
User would like to export their space or page from Confluence Cloud to Confluence 5.6.3 but they will be facing an error where they unable to complete their restoration into Self-Hosted Confluence. The reason being is that only the latest version in OD (cloud) is compatible with the latest version in server, and that version is OD 5.6-OD-39, as mentioned on this [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Migrating+from+Confluence+Cloud+to+Confluence+Server#MigratingfromConfluenceCloudtoConfluenceServer-UpgradingtoastandardConfluenceServerrelease].

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36053].
  {panel}

There was a feature prior to Confluence 3.5 that would make plain text issue keys to render as hyperlinks to their respective JIRA issue in the JIRA project linked to the Confluence space the page is located in. The lack of this feature was raised here: [https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-23693].

This functionality is present on Cloud (OnDemand) and when exporting a space/project to a local installation, these links simply disappear.

The functionality on Cloud is provided by the *Confluence Applinks Transformer Plugin* ({{com.atlassian.confluence.confluence-applinks-transformer-plugin}}), which is not available, neither is compatible with any local installation.

Please provide this plugin/functionality for BTF releases.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36044].
{panel}
When I insert a JIRA Issue/Filter macro on a Confluence page as a table, a long text is not wrapped and the width of the column is fixed by the length of the text. 
 If the the page is then exported to Word or PDF, the table either runs off the page (Word) or columns are missing entirely (PDF).

Update: The Change History macro is causing this issue. After removing the Change History macro from the Confluence page, the text is wrapping as expected and all the table columns I have defined are visible on the page even after exporting to Word and PDF formats.

Note: Depending on the number of columns defined,JIRA Issue/Filter Macro tables are prone to overflow the page when exported.

h3. Workaround
Reduce the number of columns on the JIRA Issues macro to fit on the page on Confluence without needing to scroll to right.
fields.summary: JIRA Issue/Filter Macro table column widths are not sizeable

Recent changes to the definition of Attachments as ContentEntityObjects.

h3. *Workaround*
# Search for an {{<object>}} Attachment containing the following regex: {{<property.*class="GlobalDescription"}} (i.e. a {{<property>}} tag with {{class}} {{GlobalDescription}}). Its title should be either {{global.logo}} or {{favicon-XX}} (there are different favicons). If it's not one of them, please comment on the ticket before removing.
# Remove the {{<object>}} tag (including its children)

NB: Importing into OD-39 or 42 Server releases is successful and may be helpful in working around this problem if attempting to restore a backup from a Cloud instance that has been decommissioned.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36033].
  {panel}

Hi team,

Need your help in resolving the following bug asap. Any help would be much appreciated.

*Issue:* I have a couple of epics and some stories associated with each of them in JIRA. When I created a wiki page in Confluence, I inserted some issues from JIRA using "JIRA Issue/Filter" built-in macro to display all the Epics and their respective stories in a table. 
While all the other attributes appear correctly +I am not able to get to display, the names of the Epics in the table+. I have included +Epic Name+ and +Epic Link+ both the columns, but Epic Name column in the table is empty, while Epic Link just populates the JIRA Id of the Epic in question.

*Ultimately, I need to display Epic Names in the table and not their ids.* Please suggest how this could be fixed.

+*Also, for your reference, please find the screen shot attached with the ticket*+

h3.Update

This issue seems to also affect other fields like Version. When user generates a report; instead of showing the version number; it shows the version ID instead.

For example. 

{code}
jira=> select * from projectversion where id = 17718;
  id   | project | vname | description | sequence | released | archived | url | releasedate | startdate 
-------+---------+-------+-------------+----------+----------+----------+-----+-------------+-----------
 17718 |   11200 | 1.9   |             |       10 |          |          |     |             | 
(1 row)
{code}

When a report is generated; instead of showing version 1.9 for an issue in a report; it shows 17718 instead.

When editing a page, a notification is sent to all the watchers of that page. When a user edits the title's page:

*What is expected*
* The notification should mention "User *edited the title* of a page

*What actually happens*
* The notification just sent out an email containing:
** A notification that says " User *edited* a page"
** The content of that page

Which can be misleading at times because there are no indication that the title has been changed.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35980].
  {panel}

Confluence's WebDAV is very convenient to work with attachments. Also Confluence provides an ability to edit page content as text file in WebDAV folder.
Admins can hide {{URLs}}, {{@versions}}, {{@exports}} using advanced options, described [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+a+WebDAV+client+for+Confluence]. These options make view of WebDAV folder more clear, only folders for pages/spaces and attachments are visible.

But it is possible to edit pages as text files. Historically, WebDAV server was implemented in Confluence 2.3 (CONF-3431). Confluence pages had content in wiki format, and it was easy for human to open it, understand its content, edit it and save.
The main difference between Confluence 2.3 and Confluence 5.6 from this point of view is storage/edit format. Current format is not for manual editing, but for WYSIWYG editing style. And it is hard for user to *edit* these text files, unlike it was with old good plain wiki. Especially for non-tech users. Users became confused when see text files with abracadabra in WebDAV folder.

Please, add an option to hide these text files from WebDAV view, like ones for {{URLs}}, {{@versions}} and {{@exports}} virtual folders. Additionally, I think, it worths to make this option turned off by default, because most users in most installations anyway can't edit these file directly.

There are still use cases for showing text files - for example to publish auto-created pages (build tool, report tool, etc) in Confluence. But these cases are not widely used. System admin can turn on described option in its installation. In other cases these files should be hidden.

Additionally, please, see [this comment|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+a+WebDAV+client+for+Confluence?focusedCommentId=695238827#comment-695238827].
fields.summary: Add ability to hide text files with pages content from WebDAV frolder
Add confirmation to Cancel link in edit mode.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35969].
  {panel}

h6. Steps to replicate
# Install Confluence 5.6-OD-39-039 with Oracle database
# Take XML space backup from Confluence OD
# Restore the XML backup into Confluence 5.6-OD-39-039

h6. Observed Behavior
!oracle.jpg|thumbnail!

h6. Expected Behavior
The restoration complete successfully without any error.

h6. Note:

The import works on Embeded HSQL, MySQL, Postegres and MSSQL, in case you are hitting this you could use one of the other supported databases as a workaround.


*Workaround*
# Delete any previously failed, half-imported space
# Run the following query in database:
{code}
alter table
CONTENT_PERM
DISABLE constraint
CP_UNIQUE_USER_GROUPS;
{code}
# Import Space
# Run the following query in database:
{code}
alter table
CONTENT_PERM
ENABLE constraint
CP_UNIQUE_USER_GROUPS;
{code}
(!) Please backup your database before running the above query.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35960].
  {panel}

Currently Confluence does not modify the email when it sends notification to users with favorited pages or spaces modifications.

For purposes of content control and to organize favorited contents notifications, it would be nice to have a different subject in the email when the application sends favorited contents notification to the specific users.

Example: User watches 2 pages:
Page A
Page B (favorited)

When it receives an email about updates in these pages:
Page A: Subject: "Content Updated on page A"
Page B: Subject: "Favorited Content Updated on page B"

Add "supported platforms" link to data center installation
Hex values shouldn't need the # sign

Would it be possible to Create a database migration option for Confluence

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35946].
  {panel}

h4. Problem:
When using the *Insert Markup* tool while in edit mode of Confluence. If there's a whitespace after a H1 hash character, #, text will not render. 

h4. Duplication Steps:
# Enter edit mode for a Confluence page
# Select the *Markup* tool from the under *Insert* menu
# Select *Markdown* above the Insert text box
# Place the following text:
{noformat}
# Image Demo/Product/Newsworty Stuff
* NSFW Image classifier
* Age classifier
* Selfie classifier


# Text 
{noformat}
# Preview side will then display:
{noformat}
# Image Demo/Product/Newsworty Stuff * NSFW Image classifier * Age classifier * Selfie classifier # Text
{noformat}
# Move courser to line where "Text" and remove whitespace after Text
# Preview then renders correctly
fields.summary: Whitespace after #/H1 character in markdown doesn't render

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35945]. {panel} PDF Exports of wiki page with centered images don't include images. *Steps to reproduce:* # Create a page and insert an image jpg, png etc... # Export the page to PDF. You should see that the image(s) did export. # Edit the page and align the image to the center. # Export the page to PDF again. *Expected result:* Image shows in the center. *Actual result:* Image is not displayed. *Cause:* The alignment done using the image tags is not being exported: This is the "Storage Format" of a centered image that is not exported to PDF: {noformat}

{noformat} and this is the one of an image centered by using the workaround and is exported to PDF (without alignment) {noformat}

{noformat} *Workaround:* center-align the cursor +before+ including the image to the page. The image will be added in the center and will be displayed in PDF exports.
fields.summary: Export to PDF, Centered Images are not included in .pdf file

fields.summary: Allow handling of .ico files in attachments and PDF exports
Improve page comparison: only show changed parts of a tables
LiveSearch Macro to have increased 'Label' functionality
Labels Autocomplete Suggestion should be Site Wide/ Cross Spaces

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35925].
  {panel}

h2. Summary
Some PDFs render without issue when using the PDF Macro and some display blank in version 5.4.2.  When trying view the PDF in version 5.5.+, the PDF's render with garbled special characters.  

h2. Steps to Reproduce
# Download the attached PDF
# Create a new page in Confluence
# Edit the newly created page
# Drag and drop the pdf on to the page and save

h2. Expected Result
The PDF will render as other PDFs do, showing the information in the PDF correctly.

h2. Actual Result
The PDF renders blank (or in 5.5.+, with special characters and garbled text)
fields.summary: PDF Rendering Results in Blank or Garbled Text
Make possible for a Confluence administrator to see other users drafts
Administrators should be able to see and delete drafts from all users
CONF-35911

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35917].
  {panel}

Index macro has acquired all of the pages it is in space.
If there is a large number of pages, this is the cause of high load.

https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/confluence-advanced-macros-plugin/src/eb5b70c2469f1cf6bf927d5aeec9db343d34bb5c/src/main/java/com/atlassian/confluence/plugins/macros/advanced/IndexMacro.java?at=master#cl-63

This does not necessarily have to be all pages of the space.
We want to appoint the range of the target page in a macro parameter.
fields.summary: Improve index-macro performance

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35914].
  {panel}

When you install a Confluence trial, the 'generating license step' takes a long time (several minutes). 

We should improve the message that appears with the spinner to indicate that it is setting up the trial database, and that it might take a few minutes. 

Suggest replacing existing text with:   
"Generating license and setting up trial database. This might take a few minutes"
fields.summary: Improve messaging when installing Confluence trial

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35882].
  {panel}

At default, RSS Feed will only display recent created and updated contents but not the deleted ones.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new space (Let's say RSS Space).
# Create a RSS Feed using the Feed Builder.
# Subscribe to RSS Space via the RSS Feed.
# Create a page (Let's say Page A) in the space.
# Edit Page A in the space.
# Delete Page A in the space.

h3. Expected Behaviour
• RSS Feed should show all recent entries about Page A on RSS Space which includes created, updated and deleted content.

h3. Actual Behaviour 
• All recent created or updated entries of Page A will disappear from the RSS Feed when the page is removed from the space.
!rss.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: RSS Feed should includes recent deleted entries (page, blog and etc)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35877].
  {panel}

Hello,

i am trying to update a confluence 3.0.2 instance. the data is on an oracle database - i got a empty scheme to test the update - i copy the data from the live-system to the test-db, works fine. i tried it with 3.5 and 3.5.17. i unzip the file, add ojdbc6.jar, edit confluence-init.conf to point to a copy of the confluence home, i edit server.xml to have the database connection

<Resource
							name="jdbc_confluence"
							auth="Container"
							type="javax.sql.DataSource"
							driverClassName="oracle.jdbc.OracleDriver"
							url="jdbc:oracle:thin:@(DESCRIPTION=(ADDRESS_LIST=(ADDRESS=(PROTOCOL=TCP)(HOST=DB_HOST)(PORT=1521)))(CONNECT_DATA=(SERVER=DEDICATED)(SID=DB_SID)))"
							username="db_user"
							password="db_pwd"
							connectionProperties="SetBigStringTryClob=true"
							maxActive="25"
							maxIdle="5"
							maxWait="600"
							removeAbandoned="true"
							validationQuery="select 'validationQuery' from dual"
					 />
and add this:

<resource-ref>
		<description>Connection Pool</description>
		<res-ref-name>jdbc/confluence</res-ref-name>
		<res-type>javax.sql.DataSource</res-type>
		<res-auth>Container</res-auth>
	</resource-ref>

to the server.xml


after starting confluence it recognizes it has to update, but everytime i get erros while trying to update the database - cannot create foreign keys, they are already there ... i tried it with stopping confluence, drop the foreign keys manually and proceed with the update ... after doing this about 20 times the update is finished - but the data is trash ... i can see confluence and i can log in ... but no other site will be visible - all i can see is this error in the source:

Error occurred during template rendering: Invocation of method 'getOpenSearchTitle' in  class com.adaptavist.confluence.builder.BuilderVelocityHelper threw exception java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: com.atlassian.confluence.spaces.SpaceDescription.getRealTitle()Ljava/lang/String; at templates/builder/theme/main.vmd[line 102, column 89]. Contact your administrator for assistance.

i tried it with dropping every foreign keys beore update - this way the update completed without sql-errors, but the site is broken afterwards.

i need help upgrading this confluence!

and yes i tried it with xml-backups, but this is even more buggy. i've attached the newest xml-backup.
fields.summary: No Upgrade possible from 3.0.2

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35876].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce :
# Login to Confluence
# Create a new page
# Type some text all the way to the bottom of the editor until it is not visible on your monitor
# Scroll all the way up of the page
# Try to search the text that is at the bottom of the page using Confluence in-built editor search.
# It does not go to the bottom of the page, however if you scroll down the page it have already highlighted the text

Expected behavior : When searching text in the bottom of the page, it will highlight the text and also scroll all the way down to the text position.

Current behavior : When searching text in the bottom of the page, it will highlight the text but it will not scroll all the way down to the text position.

ps: this issue occurs in Google Chrome only
fields.summary: search text does not jump to the position of the text that resides at the bottom of the page when editing page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35858].
  {panel}

*The situation*
# Having note / warning macro within a Confluence page. 
# Page is exported to PDF, coincidentally, the location of the macro box is  at the end of a page break

*What happens*
# The macro box split into 2 parts, before and after the page break (see sceenshot)

*What is expected*
# The box should start in the next page
# The box should be closed in he first page, Have another box on the second page
fields.summary: Note or Warning macro box should not split when there is a page break in PDF export
